pageContext.description: 9 fragments of bronze plate, pierced by crescentic openings and small circular holes. Ornamented by incised concentric circles and by incised lines along the (original) edges. The plate had evidently been broken deliberately. It is suggested that the plate formed part of the metal fittings of a sword scabbard, to which perhaps the Flat Loop (1934.12.9) also belonged.
pageContext.associations: Other objects of hoard see Antiq. Jour. (supra)
pageContext.publications: Proceedings, Dorset Field Club, XXV, xxxiii,Antiquaries Journal, XV, 449 ff, fig.8.
pageContext.collection: Dorchester Museum,No. 1934.12.7,Loan from the late Herbert Weld, F.S.A.,Formerly at Lulworth Castle, Dorset
